# forBaselineLayout()

**Instance Method**

Returns a view used to satisfy baseline constraints.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func forBaselineLayout() -> UIView
```

## Return Value

The view the constraint system should use to satisfy baseline constraints

## Discussion

When you make a constraint to a view’s [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/NSLayoutAttribute/NSLayoutAttributeBaseline] attribute, Auto Layout uses the baseline of the view returned by this method. If that view does not have a baseline, Auto Layout uses the view’s bottom edge.

Override this method to return a text-based subview (for example, [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UILabel] or a nonscrolling [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITextView]). If you override this method, the returned view must be a subview of the receiver. The default implementation returns the receiving view.
